message: What does the gang think about tracking our public repo github commits over time? Was looking at http://calendaraboutnothing.com/ today and saw you can group a bunch of users together to make a "group" (like the github crew http://calendaraboutnothing.com/group/mojombo,defunkt,pjhyett,schacon,tekkub,rtomayko,kneath,holman,technoweenie). I can bet that even between a few of us we'd be going strong every day for a while. I'll do my part: http://calendaraboutnothing.com/~fnichol
I finally made the 'current streak' list thanks to a current project. I'm all for more motivation to keep the chain going. (http://calendaraboutnothing.com/~theDoug)
Darn, I was really hoping they'd show a group streak as well.
I just noticed there's also a widget you can add you your site with details of your "streaking" http://calendaraboutnothing.com/~markbennett/widget

I haven't seen this before! Thanks for the link @fnichol! Sadly it looks like my longest streak is only 2 days! Does that mean I get all my code right the first time? :) http://calendaraboutnothing.com/~markbennett
@MarkBennett that's what I thought @yegrb could show. And @Doug reminded me about the caldenar. Good streak so far!
Lol, this is cool.  Apparently I've been slacking lately though :( http://calendaraboutnothing.com/~benzittlau
Here's a group calendar so far. Just add your GitHub name to the end of the url and you'll show up too!
We kick ass! Keep it going @yegrb!
